full_text: @BatmanateePhD @sunyesf So sad to hear. I wouldn‚Äôt be the scientist I am without Bill Porter. Porter & his students helped me get back on my feet, gave me field exp/mentorship & support for grad school. I‚Äôll never forget winter mammal eco & my time at AES! He was a great person & a wonderful scientist!
@BatmanateePhD @sunyesf He was instrumental in seeing me through to my first peer-reviewed journal article. I was always deeply appreciative and it‚Äôs shaped how I tackle peer review.

@BatmanateePhD @sunyesf So sad. Thanks for sharing. I will never forget taking his wildlife management course during my first semester at ESF‚Äî you were my TA! Our first draft of some paper was graded -100something points üòÇ I enjoyed his lectures. He will he missed.

@waitwait ‚Äúwe won‚Äôt define mycologists because we know our audience‚Äù are the truest words ever spoken. Senior year at @sunyesf meant 6 months of our fridge full of various fungi. All 3 roommates took mycology together that semester.

@BioTurboNick Not in Florida, no, but I am actually part of a pilot program to do this very thing in Hawaii. Waiting for the final go ahead from @Maui gov. Project is with @SyracuseU and @sunyesf and is to develop mobile labs for this in remote places (like islands in the middle of Ocean lol)

@RachaelEBee @bradcosentino @sunyesf I‚Äôve hunted them for almost 30 years & come from a long line of squirrel hunters. We raise dogs specifically for the purpose. You wouldn‚Äôt believe all the books on squirrel biology around here....dating back to the 1930‚Äôs.
@GrayFeist @bradcosentino @sunyesf Haha, I too love squirrels! Especially this time of year when they‚Äôre burying their acorns. üêø
